void getIPAddresses2Str ( ULONG  IPAddress1,
ULONG  IPAddress2,
char **  ipaddrStrp 
)

Get the 2 IP addresses for the current connection and convert it into a string in proper dotted-decimal notation.

Parameters:
IPAddress1 Address in unsigned long format to convert to ASCII
IPAddress2 Address in unsigned long format to convert to ASCII
[out] ipaddrStrp pointer to pointer to storage for the allocated string
Returns:
none
Abort:
none
Note:
The caller function is responsible to free the memory

void getIPV4V6AddressesStr ( ULONG  IPAddress,
USHORT *  pIPV6Address,
char **  ipaddrStrp 
)

Get the IPV4 and IPV6 addresses for the current connection and convert it into a string in proper dotted-decimal and colon-hexadecima notation.

Parameters:
[in] IPV4 address in unsigned long format to convert to ASCII
[in] IPV6 address in 16 bit format to convert to ASCII
[out] ipaddrStrp pointer to pointer to storage for the allocated string
Returns:
none
Abort:
none
Note:
The caller function is responsible to free the memory

Get the 2 IPV4 and IPV6 addresses for the current connection and convert it into a string in proper dotted-decimal and colon-hexadecima notation.

Parameters:
[in] IPV4 address1 in unsigned long format to convert to ASCII
[in] IPV4 address2 in unsigned long format to convert to ASCII
[in] IPV6 address1 in 16 bit format to convert to ASCII
[in] IPV6 address2 in 16 bit format to convert to ASCII
[out] ipaddrStrp pointer to pointer to storage for the allocated string
